page.title: 03MAN AND THE LANDSCAPE
page.content: Inevitably man has had a great influence on the landscape of Keighley and district.Much of the land outside of the built up area is used for {intensive grassland}farming with some{ {rough grazing.}Cattle and sheep are grazed whilst some grass is cut and stored as{silage,}which is used to feed cattle during the winter. There are several{quarries}around Keighley from which large quantities of building stone have been extracted. Some of these have been abandoned leaving large{scars on the hillsides. The town of Keighley has changed constantly with much land being used for the building of large{supermarkets with{ car parks,}a{pedestrianised {shopping centre,housing estates}and{ {industrial estates.}There has also been a build up of housing in the suburban areas and villages.
